channel.title: American Idol
channel.description: The show has become more of a laughfest then real talent. Watched it yesterday thought the entire time what is this crap? They need to get Simon back...

item.title: American Idol

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

I don’t get the point of this show, even when you win no ones hears about you ever again, other then Adam Lambert because he was gay, had sexy hair, and beautiful eyes… and I lost my train of thought.

Jordan Sparks was another one, don’t remember if she one though. As well as I believe it being was Carrie Underwood or Kelly Clarkson, one of those girls.

item.title: American Idol
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:401141”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=498203.msg3643518#msg3643518 date=1309196362]
I don’t think he would even come back, he’s got his own show now. X-Factor I think.

But I agree 100%, without Simon, the show is horrible.

Oh and we need Randy, too, dawg.
[/quote]I didnt like Randy, he was soft on some people(mostly females Lol)[/quote]
True, but he still was good at his job. There was no reason have two cruel members on the team.

item.title: American Idol
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I’ve watched American Idol when Simon use to be on it because I thought he was hilarious and the conflict that happened between him and the contestants, I never imagined he would leave American Idol.

I do believe now, American Idol has turned into some kind of laugh-fest as said above, and obtaining Simon would be a wise choice if American Idol plans on remaining open.

Read full topic
